clean_text: Sources: WHO-UNICEF Estimates of National Immunization Coverage, revision 2020 / The World Population Prospects  2019 revision, UN Population Division, New York, USA.
raw_text: Sources: WHO-UNICEF Estimates of National Immunization Coverage (WUENIC), revision 2020 / The World Population Prospects  2019 revision, UN Population Division, New York, USA.

sentences.text: Sources: WHO-UNICEF Estimates of National Immunization Coverage, revision 2020 / The World Population Prospects  2019 revision, UN Population Division, New York, USA.

clean_text: Note: Countries with high coverage in 2020 and a change in coverage within 2% from 2019: Belarus, Greece, Serbia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Turkey, and Uzbekistan.
raw_text: Note: Countries with high coverage (>=95%) in 2020 and a change in coverage within 2% from 2019: Belarus, Greece, Serbia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Turkey, and Uzbekistan.

sentences.text: Note: Countries with high coverage in 2020 and a change in coverage within 2% from 2019: Belarus, Greece, Serbia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Turkey, and Uzbekistan.

clean_text: Note: Estimates for the year 2020 are not available for the above listed 35 countries. For the regional and global aggregations, the coverage rates were imputed for the countries that did not report.
raw_text: Note: Estimates for the year 2020 are not available for the above listed 35 countries. For the regional and global aggregations, the coverage rates were imputed for the countries that did not report.

sentences.text: Note: Estimates for the year 2020 are not available for the above listed 35 countries.
For the regional and global aggregations, the coverage rates were imputed for the countries that did not report.

clean_text: Vaccine coverage: Percentage of infants who received certain vaccine-doses. For example, coverage of DTP3 is the percentage of infants that received all three doses of diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis vaccine.
raw_text: Vaccine coverage: Percentage of infants (children under one year of age) who received certain vaccine-doses. For example, coverage of DTP3 is the percentage of infants that received all three doses of diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis (DTP) vaccine.

sentences.text: Vaccine coverage: Percentage of infants who received certain vaccine-doses.
For example, coverage of DTP3 is the percentage of infants that received all three doses of diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis vaccine.

clean_text: Un-vaccinated: An infant that did not receive any vaccine. In this regional profile, un-vaccinated is defined as an infant that did not receive any DTP vaccine.
raw_text: Un-vaccinated: An infant that did not receive any vaccine. In this regional profile, un-vaccinated is defined as an infant that did not receive any DTP vaccine (not vaccinated for DTP1).

sentences.text: Un-vaccinated: An infant that did not receive any vaccine.
In this regional profile, un-vaccinated is defined as an infant that did not receive any DTP vaccine.

clean_text: Under-vaccinated: An infant that received some but not all the recommended vaccine-doses on the national schedule. In this regional profile, under-vaccinated is defined in relation to the DTP vaccination series not the entire national immunization schedule.
raw_text: Under-vaccinated: An infant that received some but not all the recommended vaccine-doses on the national schedule. In this regional profile, under-vaccinated is defined in relation to the DTP vaccination series not the entire national immunization schedule.

sentences.text: Under-vaccinated: An infant that received some but not all the recommended vaccine-doses on the national schedule.
In this regional profile, under-vaccinated is defined in relation to the DTP vaccination series not the entire national immunization schedule.

clean_text: Vaccine-Doses:  Bacillus Calmette-Guerin: vaccine against tuberculosis  Diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis vaccine, first dose and third dose  Hepatitis B vaccine, third dose  Haemophilus influenzae type B vaccine, third dose  Poliomyelitis vaccine, third dose  Measles containing vaccine, first dose and second dose  Rotavirus vaccine, last dose  Pneumococcal vaccine, third dose  Human Papillomavirus vaccine, last dose: vaccine to protect against certain types of human papillomavirus that can lead to cancer or genital warts  Yellow Fever vaccine
raw_text: Vaccine-Doses:  Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG): vaccine against tuberculosis  Diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis vaccine, first dose (DTP1) and third dose (DTP3)  Hepatitis B vaccine, third dose (HepB3)  Haemophilus influenzae type B vaccine, third dose (Hib3)  Poliomyelitis vaccine, third dose (Polio3)  Measles containing vaccine, first dose (MCV1) and second dose (MCV2)  Rotavirus vaccine, last dose (Rota)  Pneumococcal vaccine, third dose (PCV3)  Human Papillomavirus vaccine, last dose (HPV): vaccine to protect against certain types of human papillomavirus that can lead to cancer or genital warts  Yellow Fever vaccine (YFV)

sentences.text: Vaccine-Doses:  Bacillus Calmette-Guerin: vaccine against tuberculosis  Diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis vaccine, first dose and third dose  Hepatitis B vaccine, third dose  Haemophilus influenzae type B vaccine, third dose  Poliomyelitis vaccine, third dose  Measles containing vaccine, first dose and second dose  Rotavirus vaccine, last dose  Pneumococcal vaccine, third dose  Human Papillomavirus vaccine, last dose: vaccine to protect against certain types of human papillomavirus that can lead to cancer or genital warts  Yellow Fever vaccine

clean_text: The bi-scale map shows both the level of coverage and the total number of infants not vaccinated for DTP3.
raw_text: The bi-scale map shows both the level of coverage and the total number of infants not vaccinated for DTP3.

sentences.text: The bi-scale map shows both the level of coverage and the total number of infants not vaccinated for DTP3.

clean_text: The DTP3 coverage change from 2019 to 2020 scatter plot shows the change in DTP3 coverage between 2019 and 2020. Countries that experienced more than 5 percentage point drop in coverage since the previous year are labelled in dark red. Similarly, countries that experienced more than 5 percentage point increase in coverage since the previous year are labelled in dark blue. Countries with no significant changes are labelled in yellow.
raw_text: The DTP3 coverage change from 2019 to 2020 scatter plot shows the change in DTP3 coverage between 2019 and 2020. Countries that experienced more than 5 percentage point drop in coverage since the previous year are labelled in dark red. Similarly, countries that experienced more than 5 percentage point increase in coverage since the previous year are labelled in dark blue. Countries with no significant changes (less than 2 percentage points) are labelled in yellow.

sentences.text: The DTP3 coverage change from 2019 to 2020 scatter plot shows the change in DTP3 coverage between 2019 and 2020.
Countries that experienced more than 5 percentage point drop in coverage since the previous year are labelled in dark red.
Similarly, countries that experienced more than 5 percentage point increase in coverage since the previous year are labelled in dark blue.
Countries with no significant changes are labelled in yellow.
